oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Royal Crown Cola - 1947-12-27 - Excerpts // Prince Albert - 1947-12-27 - Excerpt
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Excerpts from a Royal Crown Cola sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment (9:00-9:30 pm) from December 27, 1947. Featuring Louie Buck (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Bradley Kincaid, and guest Curley Williams. Followed by an excerpt from a Prince Albert sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment (9:30-10:00 pm) from December 27, 1947. Featuring Red Foley (host/performer), and performers Rod Brasfield, and Wally Fowler. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys; Rod Brasfield
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Things That Might Have Been (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- [break] -- Louie Buck and Curley Williams talk -- Louie Buck introduces Bradley Kincaid -- [break] -- Shake My Mother's Hand For Me (Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys) -- [break] -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield) -- Red Foley talks (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Grand ole opry (Radio program); Acuff, Roy; Smoky Mountain Boys; Williams, Curley, 1913-1970; Kincaid, Bradley; Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Brasfield, Rod; Foley, Red, 1910-1968; Fowler, Wally;
